org.openadaptor.util
Class ObjectCloner

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.util.ObjectCloner
public class ObjectCloner
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class which provides a generic cloning mechanism.

Since:
3.3
Author:
higginse

Constructor Detail

ObjectCloner

public ObjectCloner()
Method Detail

setForgiving

public void setForgiving(boolean forgiving)
Flag to indicate that failure to clone won't cause an exception. If true (the default) then failure to clone will just result in a reference to the original object being returned. If false, then a RuntimeException will be thrown if an attempt is made, but fails to clone an object.

getForgiving

public boolean getForgiving()
Flag to indicate that failure to clone won't cause an exception. If true (the default) then failure to clone will just result in a reference to the original object being returned. If false, then a RuntimeException will be thrown if an attempt is made, but fails to clone an object.

setCloneMethodMapping

public void setCloneMethodMapping(java.util.Map cloneMethodMap)
Property which allows user configuration of cloning. The supplied map should contain a map of fully qualified class names paired with the name of a no-arg method which may be used to generate clones of Objects of the named class.
Any duplicate existing mapping keys will be overriden.

Parameters:
cloneMethodMap -

clone

public java.lang.Object clone(java.lang.Object object)
This will clone the supplied object if possible.
If it cannot clone the object it will, by default return a reference to the object without cloning.
Set the forgiving property to false to force a RuntimeException instead.

Parameters:
object -
Returns:
clone of the original object, or the original object if forgiving flag is set, and cloning is not possible.
